00090 #ifdef _UNICODE
00091 // If you comment the next "define" line then the library will never "switch to" _UNICODE (wchar_t*) mode (16/32 bits per characters).
00092 // This is useful when you get error messages like:
00093 //    'XMLNode::openFileHelper' : cannot convert parameter 2 from 'const char [5]' to 'const wchar_t *'
00094 // The _XMLWIDECHAR preprocessor variable force the XMLParser library into either utf16/32-mode (the proprocessor variable
00095 // must be defined) or utf8-mode(the pre-processor variable must be undefined).
00096 #define _XMLWIDECHAR
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(UNDER_CE) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(WIN64) || defined(__BORLANDC__)
00100 // comment the next line if you are under windows and the compiler is not Microsoft Visual Studio (6.0 or .NET) or Borland
00101 #define _XMLWINDOWS
00102 #endif
00103

00117 // uncomment the next line if you want no support for wchar_t* (no need for the <wchar.h> or <tchar.h> libraries anymore to compile)

00131                    // to have 'mbsrtowcs' for WIDECHAR version
00132 #endif
00133 #endif

00135 // Some common types for char set portable code

00137     #define _CXML(c) L ## c
00138     #define XMLCSTR const wchar_t *

00141 #else

00143     #define XMLCSTR const char *

00145     #define XMLCHAR char

00563       typedef struct XMLNodeDataTag // to allow shallow copy and "intelligent/smart" pointers (automatic delete):
00564       {
00565           XMLCSTR                lpszName;        // Element name (=NULL if root)
00566           int                    nChild,          // Number of child nodes
00567                                  nText,           // Number of text fields
00568                                  nClear,          // Number of Clear fields (comments)
00569                                  nAttribute;      // Number of attributes
00570           char                   isDeclaration;   // Whether node is an XML declaration - '<?xml ?>'
00571           struct XMLNodeDataTag  *pParent;        // Pointer to parent element (=NULL if root)
00572           XMLNode                *pChild;         // Array of child nodes
00573           XMLCSTR                *pText;          // Array of text fields
00574           XMLClear               *pClear;         // Array of clear fields
00575           XMLAttribute           *pAttribute;     // Array of attributes
00576           int                    *pOrder;         // order of the child_nodes,text_fields,clear_fields
00577           int                    ref_count;       // for garbage collection (smart pointers)
00578       } XMLNodeData;
